item.description:
@mterenzio I can even tell you why it's there.

Bloggers were afraid people would rip off their links.

So I put it in there, crisis averted. ;-)
Does Murdoch make the political weather or follow it? Yes. https://t.co/0Q1nwkoDVD
item.source:markdown: Does Murdoch make the political weather or follow it? Yes. https://t.co/0Q1nwkoDVD

item.description: Jerry Garcia would have been 80 years old today. https://t.co/1XIvUpF4OI

item.description:
I unfollowed @Wirecutter because every time I go there I hit a paywall, even though I am a NYT subscriber.

I get that it costs more. Fine. But if your links on Twitter always link to a paywall, well I think maybe there should be a way for me to know, eh?

cc @TwitterDev

The reason I suggest it is that a link is kind of an ad.

It says if you click here youâ€™ll learn about all this. You see a picture of the product, descriptive text, a pitch.

But when you click you realize youâ€™ve been fooled.

It could be seen as unethical. False advertising.

Note to self: This should also be part of an RSS feedâ€™s vocabulary, so a reader app can advise the human reader.

It says if you click here youâ€™ll learn about all this. You see a picture of the product, descriptive text, a pitch.
But when you click you realize youâ€™ve been fooled.

item.description: By far the best thing on Facebook are the "On this day" memories. I guess that means Facebook is winding down.
item.source:markdown: By far the best thing on Facebook are the "On this day" memories. I guess that means Facebook is winding down.

item.description:
@jeffjarvis imho: Trump is old news, really tired and troubled.

The enthusiasm is gone, they would vote for him if he was nominated, but they'd rather have a fresh Trump -- Desantis.

Not good news for Trump-the-person, but nothing's changed for MAGA.
Trump's Lawyers Are 'Quietly' Planning for Criminal Charges. https://t.co/ybOqZBSu7K
item.source:markdown: Trump's Lawyers Are 'Quietly' Planning for Criminal Charges. https://t.co/ybOqZBSu7K

item.description:
@rozzie @mkapor Also @borthwick -- I spent all last year working on Drummer. Powerful product for exactly what you're doing. This is a rich area with a lot of history. Let's do this right, and make it all work better not reinvent.

So much to say, but let's start here..

https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf

@rozzie @mkapor @Borthwick This feels like deja vu. I think we've been here before, with each of you at one time or another. ;-)

@rozzie @mkapor @Borthwick You should definitely get @stevenbjohnson in the loop.

https://t.co/SK2PyRvkFr

I believe he was involved early-on with @RoamResearch (which you should also have in there).

Also @logseq, great team, loved them so much I invested. ;-)

@rozzie @mkapor @Borthwick It also feels like there's an echo in here. ;-)

@jeffjarvis Jeff, I agree with you on almost everything -- but not this.

There are plenty of middle class and upper middle class people who vote Republican, still.

Definitely not trailer trash.

I meet them in various contexts.

@jeffjarvis Hard to believe educated well-off people don't see the danger, but I have to say I used to vote Republican myself, in the 80s and 90s.
Daily crossword puzzles free from The Washington Post. #free https://t.co/Esn5WqqlvI
item.source:markdown: Daily crossword puzzles free from The Washington Post. #free https://t.co/Esn5WqqlvI
